meanings.definition: To handle or treat roughly or aggressively.
meanings.sent1: The bully manhandled the smaller kid on the playground.
meanings.sent2: The security guard manhandled the unruly fan out of the stadium.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy manhandled the squeaky toy, making it squeal in protest.
meanings.sent4: The storm manhandled the fragile umbrella, turning it inside out.
meanings.sent5: The chef manhandled the dough, kneading it vigorously to make the perfect bread.

meanings.definition: To handle or control with force or strength.
meanings.sent1: The movers manhandled the heavy furniture up the stairs.
meanings.sent2: The wrestler manhandled his opponent, easily pinning him to the mat.
meanings.sent3: The strong winds manhandled the flimsy tent, threatening to blow it away.
meanings.sent4: The powerful waves manhandled the small boat, tossing it around like a toy.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic manhandled the stubborn bolt, finally loosening it with a wrench.
